titleStmt.title: Notification December 249 BC
titleStmt.author: Zenon, son of Agreophon, of Caunus, 1 in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p. 332-333

msContents.summary: Notification to a bank to accept a payment owing to Apollonios from Phareitis and Dionysios, holders of the lease of the bath at Philadelphia; underneath there is a note concerning a payment from the oikonomos which has no connection with the "diagraphe" above

msItemStruct.note: Written along the fibers with 15 lines; the back is blank
There are no marks of creases; this is a draft, never sent
The last 4 lines represent a notation separated from the rest by a blank space; they are probably written by a different hand at a later time

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman and New York dealer J. Brummer, through H.I. Bell, November 1925; no. 14 (original no. 35) in Bell's inventory

div.ab: Accept the payment noted below and deposit in the account of Apollonios [as under] income, silver , copper . Out of this [income): pay, in accordance with the order sent you, expenses; [both income and payment to be noted] in the same receipt. Phareitis and Dionysios, who have taken over the bath in Philadelphia, [hereby make payment] against the rent of year 37, upon Hathyr 11. [2d hand:] - - - - - from[?] the oeconomus. from Sostratos, silver, 91 [drachmas] 2 3/4 obols, copper, 151 [drachmas] 2 1/4 obols. from Etearchos, silver 45 [drachmas] 1 1/2 obols, copper, 6 [drachmas] 4 obols.
